org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.client.kineticengine

Class MultiSelectionRectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.client.kineticengine.MultiSelectionRectangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IKineticShapeWrapper

    public class MultiSelectionRectangle
extends java.lang.Object
implements IKineticShapeWrapper
    A shape always present in KineticEngine which is used to capture movement of the user's mouse. The movement selects a boundary within which we will later be looking for boxes.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl

      • setOriginalMousePosition

        public void setOriginalMousePosition(Vector2d position)
        Sets the starting point of a selection. Use this method when user clicks the left mouse button and holds it.

      • updatePath

        public void updatePath(Vector2d left,
              Vector2d up,
              Vector2d right)

        Updates the rectangle with a new mouse position somehow. Use this method when user moves their mouse while still holding the left mouse button.

        A little bit of "magic" is used here that even us don't understand anymore... This should probably be made more clear (and complex)
